description: Will not load anything
so muhchsaa2qsd

I've been using MAME since 1999 - and it's still one of the first things I install every time I get a new distro.

Boomer's candy

The GUI is clunky and doesn't respond well to the mouse; there's a tiny delay that makes it feel "squishy". In options, you have to double-click on entries - why?

In order to set the directories, you have to go in and set every single one up individually from scratch; it doesn't even try to help you by defaulting to the parent folder of the previous one. ROMs, samples, icons, ini, artwork, everything has to be set painstakingly, one by one. MAME32 did the same thing, but it was at least easier to do it. 

Lots of wasted space and large print, so it only shows a few titles at a time in what is for me (and potentially many others) a very long list.

Worst of all, it doesn't even work. I set up directories and went through items that showed as Available, then double-clicked on a couple faves (which I know work in MAME32), and they simply error out saying (this list of files) not found. Nuts to this.
Works just as intended - a whole arcade at your home
Ignore the ones shown in red.
summary: Be sure scan your roms on every MAME release

description: MAME has everything you need to run and configure old arcade games. I was able to get keyboard to run games as well as an x-box controller. It is complicated and I had to go to the MAME website and study the documentation.
summary: MAME has worked great for me!

description: Using it since 1997, sweatest thing ever made for gamers.
summary: The best arcade games emulator created
